data.text: Originating, located, or occurring outside Earth or its atmosphere.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: An extraterrestrial being or life form.
data.attributionText: from The American Heritage® Dictionary of the English Language, 5th Edition.

data.text: Occurring outside of the earth; extramundane.
originating or located or occurring outside Earth or its atmosphere.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
examples: there is no clear evidence for <ex>extraterrestrial</ex> life

data.text: a hypothetical form of life existing outside the Earth or its atmosphere, especially intelligent life on other planets or in other solar systems.
data.attributionText: from the GNU version of the Collaborative International Dictionary of English.
examples: what would you say to an <ex>extraterrestrial</ex>?

data.text: Originating from outside of the <xref>Earth</xref>'s <xref>atmosphere</xref>, from <xref>space</xref>, or from another <xref>planet</xref>; <xref>alien</xref> to Earth or its <xref>environment</xref>.
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: A being originating from outside of the <xref>Earth</xref>'s <xref>atmosphere</xref>, from <xref>space</xref>, or from another <xref>planet</xref>; an <xref>alien</xref>
data.attributionText: from Wiktionary, Creative Commons Attribution/Share-Alike License.

data.text: a form of life assumed to exist outside the Earth or its atmosphere
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.

data.text: originating or located or occurring outside Earth or its atmosphere
data.attributionText: from WordNet 3.0 Copyright 2006 by Princeton University. All rights reserved.
